section: Accuray wishes to appoint Distributor (as defined below) as a non-exclusive, worldwide distributor for the Products and Services to Customer in connection with Multiple LINAC or Multi-Modality Purchases (as defined below), subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, and Distributor wishes to accept such appointment.
explanation: The definition of 'Distributor' in Section 1.3 includes Siemens, its Affiliates, or any Third Party which has been granted distribution rights by Siemens. However, the appointment in this section only explicitly mentions appointing 'Distributor,' which could be interpreted as only Siemens itself and not necessarily its Affiliates or Third Parties. This creates ambiguity regarding whether the appointment automatically extends to Siemens' Affiliates and authorized Third Parties.

section: Distributor shall offer such potential Customers only those Products or Services described in then current price lists, and only in accordance with the applicable Customer Quote and this Agreement.
explanation: This section restricts Distributor to offering products/services in current price lists, yet Section 2.2.2 allows Distributor to seek Accuray's approval for sales at different prices. This creates a contradiction: one section limits the pricing to current lists, while another allows for deviation with approval, without clearly stating which prevails or when.

section: Accuray will defend or settle any action brought against Distributor and shall indemnify and hold Distributor harmless from any liability, damages and expenses (including court costs and reasonable attorneys' fees) to the extent that it is based upon a third-party claim that a Product, as provided by Accuray to Distributor under this Agreement is unsafe when used according to Accuray's written Specifications for its intended use, and will pay any costs and damages made in settlement or awarded against Distributor in final decision resulting from any such claim, provided that Distributor: (i) gives Accuray prompt notice of any such claim; (ii) gives Accuray sole control of the defense and any related settlement of any such claim; and (iii) gives Accuray, at Accuray's expense, all reasonable information, assistance and authority in connection with the foregoing.
explanation: This section and Section 10.1 provide indemnification for different types of claims (product liability and IP infringement, respectively). However, both indemnification clauses require that Distributor gives Accuray 'sole control of the defense'. This requirement could be problematic. There is no clause that states what happens if the Distributor does not feel comfortable with Accuray having sole control. By them having sole control this puts all the liability on Accuray.
